questions.question_text:
An employee receives an email from their internet service provider asking for their bank account number and password.
Which cybersecurity threat is this?

An organization wants to move from a tactical cloud adoption approach to a transformational approach.
How should they adapt the way they lead the organization?

choices.B: Shift from an operational expenditure model to capital expenditure
choices.D: Invest in on-premises infrastructure to redesign relationships between IT and employees
choices.A: Increase top-down visibility and foster a culture of blamelessness
choices.C: Drive cloud adoption with an individual contributor focus

discussion.content: Oddly D could be right. to transform is a culture change, which requires true collaboration instead of just lip service to it. investing in physically co-locating stakeholders would help shift the culture.

Selected Answer: A
A is correct

Selected Answer: A
A. Increase top-down visibility and foster a culture of blamelessness.

To move from a tactical cloud adoption approach to a transformational approach, an organization needs to change the way it leads the organization. This includes increasing top-down visibility and fostering a culture of blamelessness.

Top-down visibility means that leaders need to communicate the organization's cloud strategy and goals clearly and often. They need to explain why the organization is moving to the cloud and the benefits that it will bring.
A,B and C are all correct answers. The only option which is not true is D.

Selected Answer: B
If your objective is to innovate with net new applications that solve new business problems (i.e., transformational) then we recommend taking the greenfield software development approach.
https://cloud.google.com/blog/products/cloud-migration/real-world-cloud-migration-strategies
